answers.answer: Hi and very sorry you are experiencing this. Due to your symptoms and lack of other symptoms it is hard to say for sure that you have Chikungunya, so you should see a doctor right away. But it is the most close, disease symptom wise, and since they have outbreaks of it in the area to Chikungunya. Since you are young and healthy if this is Chikungunya if you get the other symptoms of fever, muscle pain, rash, or headache those go away in about a week. The joint pain takes about a month.  If you have diabetes, high blood pressure or heart problems it can be more serious.  You can take Ibuprofen for the joint pain as directed by the package. It would be good for you to see a doctor to make sure this isn't something more serious.  Be sure to rest, take in plenty of fluids (8 glasses of water or combined fluids a day) and the Ibuprofen for pain if it doesn't contradict anything you are taking now. It doesn't sound like the symptoms of dengue. I wouldn't put it off it would be best to go in and get checked by a doctor.mkh9

question: I am a 23 year old caucasian male and am very healthy. <48 hrs ago I was awoken in the middle of the night with severe pain in the MCP joints of digits 4 and 5. 12 hours later the pain and inflammation began to spread to digit 3 then to digit 2. 4 hours after swelling and pain progressed to the the PIP joints of digits 2-5 on right hand. Pain and swelling has continued to be severe since. About 5 hours ago Pain began in my MTP joint of 5th digit and has sense spread to the MTP joints of long, 3rd & 4th. As of now trying to put any pressure on my foot is almost the worst pain I have ever felt.If anyone has any ideas of what this could be please chyme in.  Could it be Chikungunya, without the acute febrile (fever) phase? The only symptoms I have are the joint pain. I live in the Caribbean where there has been outbreaks of this recently.Thank you
title: Symptoms
